intro: Hiraea angustipetala, commonly known as the narrow-petalled hiraea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals arranged symmetrically. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth.
